metadata.title: CVE-2016-2779 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
runuser in util-linux allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-2779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
bsdutils - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
eject - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
fdisk - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libblkid1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libfdisk1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libmount1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libsmartcols1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
libuuid1 - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
mount - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
rfkill - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
util-linux-locales - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
uuid-runtime - 2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> 2.31 introduced a --pty option that can be used eslerm> upstream revereted their patch backporting 2.31's optional --pty flag has high risk potential

criterions.comment: util-linux package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.33.1-0.1ubuntu2').
